TopicTitle: Mun base Pole location choosing Poll

Articles.Content: Hello! My name is HowTo:KSP. So I sent a probe to find water on the mun to build a self-sustaining base on the mun with TAC Life support and Kerbal Planetary base systems. Most water turned out to be near the poles so I was wondering north or south pole?

Well, for staters, I think this thread would be better off in General Discussion, and the mods may too, so don't be surprised if it gets moved.

Second point: What's the cutoff point for the resource scans there? Take it as high as you can before they all disappear, then roll it back one click. Whichever is the larger patch is the one you'd aim for, all else being equal.

 

Honestly, you'd need to look at the slopes there. If it's really hilly and steep at one, you'd want to go to the other. So punt a SAR sat out there and take a good hard look to see what's there.

North Pole is super evil. South Pole is slightly less evil, but still really evil. Polar terrain is really crazy almost everywhere, and plus it has a tendency to murder Kerbals who stand right on top of the poles.

Maybe make your base mobile. Mobility is useful. Plus then you can get resources from everywhere, not just one spot. You can use Kerbal Planetary Base Systems and make a really big rover. Use the base parts to store stuff and to have the crew modules. Add some science and resource scanners. If you also want to refuel other ships, use surface docking or KAS. If you make a stationary base, USE LEGS!!! Otherwise it will slide around and explode. 

Is this a challenge? If it's a challenge, then you should add rules and stuff. Or maybe you should ask to have it moved.
As there is no challenge in this thread, it has been moved to general discussion.

Sensible mode: Pick the furtherst spot from either pole that has enough water.

Fun mode: Design a ball-shaped base that doesn't care about terrain undulations.

It's madness to make a base there.   and I wish you luck =)
